general_advisory: Farmers are advised to irrigate their field as there is mild dry condition prevailing. Various crop-specific advisories are provided for managing pests and diseases.

advisory: To manage stem borer, use Trichogrammajaponicum card @ 1/acre weekly for 6 times.
Apply Cartap Hydrochloride 4% G @ 8kg/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 0.4% GR @ 4kg/acre or Imidacloprid 0.3% GR @ 6kg/acre.
To manage Aphid and Painted Bug infestation, spray Neem Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre.
Chemically spray Thiamethoxam 25% W.G @ 40g/acre or Acetamiprid 20% S.P. @ 50g/acre or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 60-ml/acre.
To manage stem rot, drench soil with Validamycin 3% L @ 400-ml/acre or Captan 70% + Hexaconazole 5% WP@ 300-gram/acre.
To manage powdery mildew disease, spray Sulphur 80% WP @ 800-gram/acre or Hexaconazole 5% E.C @ 300-ml/acre.
To manage powdery mildew disease, spray Sulphur 80% WP @ 800-gram/acre or Hexaconazole 5% E.C @ 300-ml/acre.
To manage Early Blight disease, spray Mancozeb 75% WP @600g/acre or Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63% W.P @ 400g/acre.
To manage Diamond Back Moth and Head Borer infestation, collect and destroy caterpillars and egg masses, and spray Neem based Pesticide.
Chemically spray Tolfenpyrad 15 % EC @ 400-ml/acre or Flubendiamide 20 % WG @ 20-gram/acre or Chlorfenapyr 10 % SC @ 400-ml/acre or Spinosad 45 % SC @ 75-ml/acre.
To control Aphid, spray neem oil formulation @ 600ml per acre or Flonicam @ 60g per acre.
To manage Epilachna Beetle, shake plants to dislodge grubs, pupae, and adults, and spray neem-based pesticide at early stage of infestation.
To control thrips, spray Fenpyroximate 5% EC @ 2 ml or Abamactin @ 1 ml per litre of water.
Maintain water depth up to 6 ft for fish hibernating in the warmer bottom zone.
